item.title: It means everything - Raducanu on US Open win
item.description: Emma Raducanu says she does not want to let go of the US Open trophy as her fairytale in New York culminates in the ultimate happy ending.

item.title: England vaccine passport plans ditched, Sajid Javid says
item.description: A vaccine passport scheme for nightclubs and large events in England will not go ahead, minister says.

item.title: Emma Raducanu's hometown celebrates win
item.description: This is how people in Bromley, London – including her former tennis coach – reacted to the result.

item.title: Queen praises Raducanu's 'outstanding' performance
item.description: The Queen leads the congratulations to Emma Raducanu after the 18-year-old Briton clinches the US Open title with victory against Leylah Fernandez.

item.title: Great North Run 2021: Thousands set off as event returns
item.description: The world's biggest half-marathon is back for its 40th running after 2020's hiatus due to Covid.

item.title: Yes Sir, I Can Boogie singer dies aged 69
item.description: María Mendiola, one of the members of the duo Baccara, has died in Madrid at the age of 69.

item.title: FBI begins declassifying documents into Saudi 9/11 links
item.description: The memo lists some contact between Saudi nationals and hijackers, but does not implicate the government.

item.title: Afghanistan: Pen Farthing 'so happy' as rescue workers escape
item.description: Staff at his animal shelter successfully crossed from Afghanistan to Pakistan, says Pen Farthing.

item.title: Pope warns of anti-Semitism as he visits Hungary
item.description: Francis also meets PM Viktor Orban, who holds starkly divergent views on immigration and refugees.

item.title: Clacton stabbing: Two men, three boys and woman held in murder probe
item.description: The victim, a 21-year-old man, died in hospital after suffering a fatal knife wound, police say.

item.title: Fabrice Muamba's son faced 'monkey chants' in school rugby game
item.description: A top school is investigating after Fabrice Muamba says his son faced racist abuse in a rugby game.

item.title: World's largest container ship arrives at Felixstowe
item.description: The Ever Ace, which is 400m-long (1,300ft) and can carry 23,992 containers, is on her maiden voyage.

item.title: TUC: Jobs at risk if UK fails to hit carbon emissions target
item.description: Trade bodies and unions say the UK is slipping behind other nations on green investment.

item.title: In pictures: Silence and tears as US remembers 9/11 attacks
item.description: Ceremonies are held in New York, Virginia and Pennsylvania to mark the lives lost 20 years ago.

item.title: The Papers: Jabs at school in two weeks and travel tests axed
item.description: The papers report on vaccine plans for 12- to 15-year-olds and travel changes for the fully jabbed.

item.title: Photographer's images 'like ghosts coming out the mist'
item.description: Guy Bellingham uses a 170-year-old technique to produce striking photos in remarkable detail.

item.title: ‘I offered them a snake, but they gave me a zoo’
item.description: Roughly 40% of the animals at Rutland Zoo come from other rescues.

item.title: 'I care about the climate but my dad works in the oil industry'
item.description: Stephanie worries about climate change, but her dad is a senior employee at BP.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'breaking free'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: Quiz of the week: What did the 'talking' duck say?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Women's state pension: 'It is like you've lived one big lie'
item.description: How women born in the 1950s had their retirement plans upended by state pension age changes.

item.title: Phil Wang: I wouldn’t be a comic if I weren't mixed-race
item.description: The TV and stand-up star talks about loneliness, family, food and his viral Tom Hiddleston video.

item.title: Keeping up with the Californians: Recall vote 2021
item.description: A ragtag bunch of 46 challengers hope voters will remove the governor and let them run California.

item.title: The chilling day the swastika flew beside the union jack
item.description: The image may be the only time the union jack was pictured together with the swastika in Britain.

item.title: Why is there a food emergency in Sri Lanka?
item.description: With a weak economy and worsening Covid-19 situation, a food emergency has been declared in the country.

item.title: 'Vaccine passports make me even more reluctant to get a Covid jab'
item.description: The new uni term starts soon but anyone who isn't fully vaccinated won't be allowed into clubs.

item.title: Covid: UK expats struggle with Australia lockdowns
item.description: People who left the UK to settle in Australia tell what life has been like during six lockdowns.

item.title: Ronaldo was 'super nervous' before two-goal Man Utd return
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo was "super nervous" before scoring twice on his Manchester United return - as boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says he has allowed fans to "dream" again.

item.title: Italian Grand Prix: Max Verstappen on pole after Valtteri Bottas wins sprint
item.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen will start the Italian Grand Prix from pole position with Lewis Hamilton down in fourth.

item.title: Grown men dancing and endless chanting - Ronaldo's dream return lights up Old Trafford
item.description: Grown men dancing and endless chanting - Cristiano Ronaldo's triumphant return was a day to remember at Old Trafford.

item.title: Emma Raducanu wins US Open by beating Leylah Fernandez for maiden Grand Slam
item.description: Emma Raducanu ends Britain's 44-year wait for a women's Grand Slam singles champion as she beats Leylah Fernandez to win the US Open.

item.title: Emma Raducanu tells BBC she's 'ready for anything'
item.description: The new US Open champion spoke to the BBC after beating Leylah Fernandez in straight sets.

item.title: US Open highlights: Emma Raducanu beats Leylah Fernandez to win maiden Grand Slam
item.description: Watch the best shots as Emma Raducanu wins the women's US Open to become the first British female winner at Flushing Meadows since Virginia Wade in 1968 and the first qualifier in the Open era to win a Slam.

item.title: Emma Raducanu: The making of Great Britain's US Open champion
item.description: As British teenager Emma Raducanu wins the US Open, BBC Sport charts her rapid rise - with the help of a host of experts.

item.title: Watch the winning moment
item.description: Watch the moment Britain's Emma Raducanu beats Canada's Leylah Fernandez to win the US Open women's singles final in straight sets.

item.title: Covid passports: How do I get one and when will I need it?
item.description: People in Scotland will need to be fully vaccinated to go to clubs, sporting events and concerts.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Stamp duty holiday: How much do I have to pay now?
item.description: Stamp duty rules are changing in England and Northern Ireland

item.title: Covid: How do I get the vaccine and will I need a booster?
item.description: A third dose is being offered to up to half a million people in the UK with weakened immune systems.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's population, as more than 48 million people have received at least one dose.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Flu jab 2021: Who’s eligible for a free vaccine?
item.description: This year's roll out has expanded in an attempt to shield against a double whammy of flu and Covid.

item.title: Universal credit: When will the £20 increase stop?
item.description: The government has confirmed the £20 boost will end in the autumn.

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: Significant numbers have had long-term problems after recovering from the original infection.

item.title: Back to school: How are pupils being kept Covid-safe?
item.description: Many children are returning to school after the holidays, while Scottish pupils already returned.

item.title: Covid: Will I need a jab and what will university be like this term?
item.description: Many Covid restrictions have been lifted for students going to university this term.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland?
item.description: Lockdown rules are changing across the UK, but some restrictions remain in place.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in other parts of the UK.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Millions of children, including 16- to 17-year-olds, are now being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: A traffic light system is in place setting out rules for entering the UK

item.title: Covid: How is furlough changing and when will it end?
item.description: The furlough scheme, which protected millions of jobs during the pandemic, is in its final weeks.

item.title: September 11 attacks: What happened on 9/11?
item.description: How the devastating 2001 plane attacks on America unfolded and how they shaped our age.

item.title: 9/11 anniversary: Left without a parent after that day
item.description: How the terror attacks affected those whose parents died or were injured in the attacks.

item.title: September 11: The heroes of the forgotten maritime rescue mission
item.description: On 11 September, 2001, nearly 500,000 people were evacuated by boat from southern Manhattan.

item.title: 9/11 anniversary: How the world reacted to terror attacks
item.description: Two decades on, four people from around the world reflect on that day, and what's changed since.

item.title: The hard men removing squatters in Spain
item.description: Some squatters in Spain demand cash before leaving - so eviction firms have arisen to handle the talks.

item.title: Afghanistan: Shukria Barakzai's whispered voice notes and dramatic escape
item.description: The desperate messages sent by Afghan politician Shukria Barakzai to a UK MP as the Taliban tried to hunt her down.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'undefeated' Panjshir Valley - an hour from Kabul
item.description: The Panjshir Valley has been a flashpoint in Afghanistan's turbulent history - now it's happening again.

item.title: Bilal Sarwary: 'The plane hit the tower and all our lives changed'
item.description: Afghan journalist Bilal Sarwary was selling carpets when 9/11 happened. From that day on, everything changed.

item.title: Shot in the head in Angola, left for dead, now a Wetherspoons star
item.description: Cesar Kimbirima fled Angola after being shot four times and spending five months in a coma.
